Text: My office recently helped Mohamed get his passport through the process in a timely manner. One of the important jobs my office does is help #WA08 residents when they come up against issues with federal agencies. If you need assistance, call my Issaquah office at 425-657-1001. https://t.co/EdbDCEZvDl
I recently sat down with KOMO to talk about a few different issues, including my new bill that will suspend the gas tax until 2023 and bring down the cost of gas. Watch here: https://t.co/iPw35KrPa6

It was so great to host USDA Under Secretary Torres Small in Pierce County this week! We visited Windmill Gardens in Sumner & announced that they + 3 other 8th district farms received $250,000 USDA grants to help them during this difficult time. More info: https://t.co/05MiSXk9Sa

Earlier this week I took time to donate blood. You may not know this but our country has a serious blood shortage right now. You never know when you or someone you love will need it. So make an appointment to donate blood and give back to our community: https://t.co/tVU5nKRLif https://t.co/BRJMkkA4gX

Today I helped introduce the Gas Tax Relief Act. People in our district are feeling the pinch at the grocery store & gas pump. What's infuriating is that this is happening when oil + gas companies are making record profits. A gas tax holiday will get relief to families right away https://t.co/1xG7akYKRR

In today's #SubOversight hearing, I spoke about the benefits and potential harm social media can have on teen mental health. And I asked our expert panelists what role parents and schools can play in helping kids and teens with their mental health. Watch below! https://t.co/WbyY9cDRmx

It is never too early to get your home and property prepared for wildfire season. Our state is seeing increasingly catastrophic wildfires every year. We can all do our part to prevent wildfires and protect our communities. https://t.co/6YwYoz32dD https://t.co/BPQJSuWsT3

I'm looking forward to participating in this #SubOversight hearing today. I'll be focusing on the mental health challenges many children and teens are facing right now and how social media can affect mental health. Tune in here: https://t.co/ZQeJA9USdE https://t.co/nN98c7gXJW

This week I visited Out of the Box Manufacturing to discuss the COMPETES Act and tour their production floor. The COMPETES Act will directly benefit American manufacturers by alleviating supply chain burdens, addressing the microchip shortage, and creating jobs. https://t.co/Pt5Wor55LG

It was so great to host @usdaRD Under Secretary Torres Small in Pierce County today! We announced that 4 farms in the 8th district have each received $250,000 grants to create jobs and boost innovation. We also met with mayors about supporting small towns. I'm excited to be hosting @usdaRD Under Secretary Torres Small in Pierce County today to meet with mayors and make an announcement about farm grant funding. https://t.co/hi46UsiSeE

I am so grateful for the service and sacrifice of our Veterans. Thank you to everyone who participated this year to create valentines for our district's Veterans. I recently dropped them off to be distributed to Veterans at the Orting Soldiers Home. https://t.co/Nxd7Ll92Jm

Today I stopped by @BloodworksNW to donate blood. We are in the middle of a serious blood shortage and we can all do our part. In honor of Valentine's Day, share your love with our community by scheduling a donation! https://t.co/ECpOtQHe5w https://t.co/SYVX8fc5MI

I was glad to see that the SR 18 project was fully funded in the #MoveAheadWA package! These investments can be made in part because of over $3 billion in funding from the bipartisan infrastructure law. I will continue working with state & local leaders on districtâ€™s priorities. https://t.co/GktWk5M9IP

In the last few weeks alone, my office has received over a dozen calls from residents reporting issues with their local post office. This week I voted for the Postal Service Reform Act that will bring increased transparency & improved delivery schedules to the USPS. https://t.co/KUbRSOxxbd

Many families are feeling the pinch at the supermarket and at the gas pump. This bill makes one of the biggest public investments to spur domestic manufacturing, monitor gaps, and ensure that we can address shortages before they happen. This bill needs to be signed into law ASAP. https://t.co/qYZ5G4yN22
My office is taking internship applications for Summer 2022! Apply at https://t.co/1eeB3FI1vM. The application window closes on March 10, 2022 at 11:59PM ET. https://t.co/zViuLgyMpf

Iâ€™m thankful for residents who contacted my office about KVH struggling to access testing supplies. My staff & I worked with all the government agencies involved to get KVH the supplies they needed. Iâ€™m glad to see testing clinics are back open! More info: https://t.co/p7hQwL6Jqw

This week @RepRichHudson and I intro'd a bill to make it easier to hire doctors & help with staffing shortages during this pandemic &  future crises. This program is like a national guard for docs, allowing them to be deployed where they are needed most. https://t.co/7DtzTlJRcu

The @forestservice recently released a 10-year strategy to help tackle the growing wildfire crisis. This is a familiar issue to many people and businesses in #WA08. That's why I recently held a virtual conversation so stakeholders could learn more. https://t.co/dxNeqQqJgK

The @USPS delivers life-saving medications, paychecks, and much more. That's why today I was glad to vote for the bipartisan Postal Service Reform Act that will increase transparency and ensure that the USPS can continue to provide service for years to come. https://t.co/SDQkxjcASV

It is remarkable that the power of the federal government joined w/ private industry had effective COVID shots in arms in less than a year. In today's @EnergyCommerce hearing, I spoke about how this is the power that we are looking to harness in other ways, like cures for cancer. https://t.co/2XXFOYh0JS

Fine print hidden in a lengthy contract shouldnâ€™t be what denies a sexual abuse survivor their day in court. That's why today I will be voting for the  #EndForcedArbitration Act â€“ to make sure survivorsâ€™ voices are heard.
Salmon are already returning to streams that had been dry for years, newly restored by this project.

I was in Kittitas County recently visiting the South Branch Canal Efficiency Project. The project is part of the Yakima Basin Integrated Plan, which thoughtfully allocates scarce water resources for farmers, fish, and communities. https://t.co/rVEopjY8IM

We can't be caught flatfooted again https://t.co/CjdiYIJKD2 https://t.co/woRvDeqq6k

Today I was proud to vote for #AmericaCOMPETES that will mitigate supply chain disruptions, bring down consumer costs & spur domestic manufacturing so we are less reliant on other countries like China for critical goods. Last week I led a letter with @RepMalinowski to HHS asking Medicare to cover at-home tests to mitigate the spread of COVID-19. And they announced this morning that they will do just that! I'm glad to see this increased access for Medicare beneficiaries. https://t.co/QgwR9IPU2b

I've been hearing about price gouging by shipping companies for over a year and now we have proof. That is why this week I'm working to again pass the bipartisan Ocean Shipping Reform Act, to crack down on shippers' unfair fees and record profits at the expense of U.S exporters. https://t.co/hJ7kxOHJPq

I'll be speaking in this hearing soon about the conservation programs in the Farm Bill. I'll be asking about what we can do and what USDA's  plans are to ensure that all farmers who want to participate in USDA conservation programs are able to do so. https://t.co/qMFEV0Fpyz
This is positive news and I'm sure welcome news for parents with little ones! I look forward to learning more in the coming days. https://t.co/TTBXoiV9Ix

Most schools schedule lunch before recess & students will rush or even skip lunch to go play. Putting recess first makes time for both, and evidence shows kids eat more food and healthier options if theyâ€™ve had a chance to run around outside before lunch. https://t.co/B9srb7i8MN

This week @RepBonamici and I re-introduced the Healthy Meal Time Act! Putting play first & lunch second will ensure kids get enough exercise and good nutrition. As a pediatrician and mom I know that both are vital to children's development.
Happy #LunarNewYear to everyone celebrating in #WA08 and around the world! https://t.co/eexzfC61RH

Today, the FDA granted full approval for the Moderna vaccine, confirming what we already knew: these vaccines are safe and effective. Vaccines saves lives, and I encourage everyone to get their shot to keep themselves and their communities safe. https://t.co/w9MX8RhHUk
My next town hall will be a telephone town hall on Thursday, February 3rd @ 5:00 p.m. PT! To make sure you get a call, sign up here: https://t.co/j1dXI8P4Kk https://t.co/eMerI08HbW

Their app, GardenAid, is designed to help reduce water waste. GardenAid will be showcased at #HouseOfCode later this year. https://t.co/QOVwYvLVKP
Congratulations to Eastlake High School students Aakarsh Agrawal and Rushil Arun, and Rishi Aniga of International Community School for winning the 8th Districtâ€™s 2021 Congressional App Challenge!

This week I visited the Lake Tapps Reservoir to see their intake, fish screen, dike system, and old powerhouse. I'm glad that the Cascade Water Alliance is maintaining the system & making improvements to make sure we have a strong regional water infrastructure for years to come. https://t.co/BlH3kcF9T3

This morning I joined @Fox13Seattle to talk about a bill I introduced today to make sure children are getting enough time to eat at lunch. We should make sure they are eating & aren't just trying to get through lunch as quickly as possible to get to recess or back to class. https://t.co/TNDQf1j6pj

On #HolocaustRemembranceDay, we honor the millions of innocent people who senselessly lost their lives. With a rise in hate and anti-Semitic acts in our country, we much recommit ourselves to standing up against bigotry. #NeverAgain

Yesterday I met with Iron Workers Local 86 apprentices and spoke with them about labor rights, the COVID pandemic, and how the bipartisan infrastructure law will help the economy and create jobs. https://t.co/JwSVd8o3Xi

As part of the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, Congress passed a permanent program to help families afford internet service, which is crucial now more than ever.

Find out if you qualify for up to $30 off your internet bill, or up to $75 on Tribal lands: https://t.co/jfFA0uuLTt

This week I visited the Orting Veterans Village, a partnership between @WDVA & the Puget Sound Veterans Hope Center to house homeless Veterans. Right now there are 35 tiny homes. I learned more about the project and how the Veterans are settling in since moving in last spring. https://t.co/LvnuCa9cq5

Iâ€™m honored to be co-chairing the SEEC Climate and Ag Task Force w/ @chelliepingree! Farmers and ranchers are at the front lines of the climate crisis. Recent projects include Fireblight and Little Cherry Disease Management & Decision Support for Managing Climate Risks in Tree-Fruit. https://t.co/cBJpsQBpIv

Today I welcomed @USDA Under Secretary Moffitt to Wenatchee to announce $72.9 million in funding for Specialty Crop Block Grants. The Block Grant program has been crucial to our stateâ€™s tree fruit industry. Thank you to Stemilt Growers for the tour of your facility! https://t.co/SyKGYkdqrs

It has been great to see increasing access for at-home COVID-19 tests at no cost for millions of Americans. But there is more to do. That is why I was glad to join @RepMalinowski is sending a letter to HHS to ensure Medicare pays for at-home tests to mitigate the spread of Covid. https://t.co/TpzVXsXT03

I recently visited the FEMA vaccination site in Auburn to administer vaccines to Washingtonians. They accept walk-ins and have many appointments available every day. Visit  https://t.co/MTSDdLfRYs for more information and to make an appointment! https://t.co/gubUB0Zy34

Our state faces increasingly catastrophic wildfires every year. If youâ€™ve been impacted by a fire, your land might be more susceptible to flooding. Check out these resources from FEMA to learn about the National Flood Insurance Program. https://t.co/LGTaJzAu3U #FloodSmart

This week I was proud to vote for the EVEST Act that will provide a "warm handoff" between DoD & VA help to ensure Veterans are supported as they transition out of the military. As a doctor I understand how important it is to prevent Veterans from falling through the cracks. https://t.co/Dkza3lYgiY

On the anniversary of Roe v. Wade, I remain committed to protecting a woman's right to make her own decisions. And as one of the only female doctors in Congress, I will continue to be a voice against medically-unnecessary restrictions so every woman can access the care they need.

It's great to see that Washingtonians will have yet another way to access free, at-home Covid tests. Rapid tests are an important tool & I have been pushing for more availability of these tests for months now. This is another benefit from the ARP to send $ to states for testing. https://t.co/1v6kh1VoGa

Today @HouseAgDems held a hearing on the state of the rural economy w/ USDA Secretary Vilsack. I asked Sec. Vilsack about the ongoing trade wars and retaliatory tariffs that continue to hurt tree fruit growers & making sure all farmers are included in USDA conservation programs.

This morning I am also participating in the #SubOversight hearing on the energy impacts of cryptocurrency and blockchains. I'm excited that the 8th District's own Steve Wright, formerly of Chelan PUD, will be joining the hearing as a witness! Tune in: https://t.co/3dveg6XRds https://t.co/eTBlVkqTQf

Just sent a letter to @POTUS urging action on making more quality masks available for kids. 400 million N95 masks will soon be free at pharmacies but those are for adults. Quality masks for kids will keep them safe in school & protect kids who aren't yet eligible for the vaccine. https://t.co/SNFzTYvX9O

I'm looking forward to my first 2022 town hall this evening with two experts from Fred Hutch to talk about the future of Covid and what the variants mean for that future. RSVP and submit questions here: https://t.co/IbA2zymqDz https://t.co/jIVRnS2ehu

You can now order up to 4 tests per household at https://t.co/3zL5YSm0eU! I'm glad to see the Administration increasing access to rapid tests and will continue to work with them to increase supply and availability around the country. This is another good step forward.

I am monitoring this distressing situation and praying for the safe release of all hostages. https://t.co/EmWJGmlN5N

.@WANationalGuard has been called upon at unprecedented levels to help our state administer vaccines, distribute food at food banks, and now assist with the storm response in Leavenworth. https://t.co/jz3APkLOyM

Starting Sat. you could be reimbursed for rapid test purchases. This is still more complicated than it has to be but it moves toward the goal of making testing more affordable. This week I joined firefighters from across WA and @Conserve_WA for a prescribed burn in Roslyn Urban Forest. And I tried my hand at a drip torch. Prescribed fire is one of the tools we should be using more of to prevent such catastrophic wildfires every summer. https://t.co/N2avwDmsoM

On Thursday I joined Chris Hansen on KOHO101 to talk the federal infrastructure legislation we are working on in DC and efforts I am taking to help our state mitigate wildfires. You can listen here: https://t.co/37fmq2YoDQ

Today I sent @POTUS a letter urging him to issue an executive order to streamline the process for approving rapid, at-home COVID tests. So far, the U.S. has approved eight tests, with only three tests currently available for purchase, compared to 36 in the UK and 34 in Germany. https://t.co/ACGGZfRET1

Yesterday I was thrilled to join firefighters from across WA and @Conserve_WA for a prescribed burn in Roslyn. In Congress I have been pushing to increase funding for prescribed fire, a tool that can be deployed to prevent more catastrophic fires during the fire season. https://t.co/Fl8LJY6nU0

It's great to see the Biden Admin invest in & quadruple the # of rapid tests. It's almost impossible to find a rapid test right now, so this is welcome news. Now I hope that more tests on the market will mean reduced cost per test, making them accessible for regular, everyday use https://t.co/Qx9qvcKhIt
